intro: Eremophila interstans, commonly known as the narrow-leaved emu bush, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from red to pink. The plant is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it drought-tolerant and suitable for xeriscaping. It produces small, woody fruits that contain seeds dispersed by wind, contributing to its ecological role in native ecosystems.
